choices: Try to behave for the year until your powers are given back.
Try to make a change without magic.
1.content:
"It's not like I didn't have a reason." you complain to your best friend Juliet who is seated beside you on your bedroom floor. "If I didn't cast that spell those poor kids would have been eaten by that troll" your friend nods to you, the look on her face tells you that she's deep in thought.

"The elders would have made it so that the NMO's (non-magical outsiders) would have thought it was a bear attack or something. No one would ever know what happened, and It's not like those two were important or anything." Everyone in your community has the same attitude to NMO's as Juliet does. They believe that all NMO's are useless beings capable of nothing more than destruction. "The Council said that they'd give you your powers back in a year if you behaved"

You frown at what your friend said to you. "You just don't understand. Even if they are NMO's they still have a family who I imagine care for them very much. How can we allow that kind of thing to happen?" Juliet shakes her head. "I'm not saying that you're wrong. I actually agree that something should change, but talk like that won't give you your powers back. There's nothing you can do without your powers anyway. So just be good and wait until they give you your powers back"

wander around looking for something to do.

"I guess you're right." you tell Juliet "If I want to make a change it'll have to be when I have good standing with the others." Juliet gives you a weak smile and begins to stand up. "I have to go now. I have to get to school." You wave good bye to your friend as she leaves.

Usually you'd be going to school too but now that you can't cast. Spell classes would be useless to attend. for the first couple of hours you stay in your room trying to keep yourself entertained but become completely bored. most everything that you did when you were alone required magic in order to use.

Once you completely have nothing to do you decide to...
11.title: boredom

choices: Accept the ride.
Decline and continue to walk
111.content:
You decide you'll find some sort of NMO gadget to keep you busy for a little while. The problem with most Witch toys and devices is that so many of them require magic just to use. The Witch community you currently live in is actually just outside of a rather big NMO city in England. NMO's don't tend to go there however, due to the magical enchantments set around the outsides of it.

Unfortunately for you, however, you forgot that you have no way into the city, other than your own two feet. You begin walking anyways, because you realize how boring it's going to be without something to do. Luckily the skies are clear, and it's a rather warm day. You find the road that leads directly to the city and begin walking along side it,

After having walked for an hour you realize that the city is still a significant distance away and your feet are starting to get sore, but you're still determined and you've already spent an hour walking, so you continue on. Shortly after you see a car pull up alongside you, The driver's side door opens up and you see a man who looks to be in his early twenties step out of the vehicle, "Hey kid what are you doing walking out here all by yourself?" He looks down at you, he's at least a half foot taller than you.

"I'm no kid! I'm seventeen." you respond a little annoyed already from having to walk "I'm heading into the city"

He Smirks arrogantly at you then gives a hearty laugh "Well I'm heading into the city myself, need a ride?"

You look past him and into the vehicle and notice a backpack, perhaps he's a student. Plus if you got a ride you may be able to get home before nightfall. On the other hand he might have darker intentions then just giving you a ride, and without your powers you'd have a difficult time defending yourself.
111.title: Driver.

choices: A game store: Some electronics will help keep you occupied.
Clothing Store: A young lady must look her best.
A book Store:  Books are great for wasting a few days.
1111.content:
You open the passanger side door. "yeah I guess" You grab his bag from the seat to move it to the back, but notice that it is incredibly heavy. You move it to the backseat as he gets back into the car. you are about to ask him what's in the bag when he says "What's your name kid, Where are you from?" You frown as he calls you a kid again. He clearly enjoys that nickname for you. You tell him your name begrudgingly and tell him that you're from a small town down the way a bit. The man gives you a skeptical look but begins the car, and pulls it back onto the road.

You both stay silent for a the next couple of minutes, It's very awkward and you're certain that you should say something, you spend a couple minutes just looking out the window. It's been quite some time since you've travelled by car. You think your uncle owned one when you were little, Usually you'd just travel by broom if you needed to go somewhere.

"I take it you don't travel much." The man points out. you look at him stunned for a moment "Why do you say that" He chuckles to himself. The way you look out the window, It's easy to tell"

You sigh as you sit in the cramped car. all cars seem crowded compared to the wide open sky. "Are you from the city?" you ask him politely changing the subject, Trying your best not to give away who you really are.

"Yes actually, I've lived there my whole life." you try to add something to that but cannot think of anything smart to say. Again the two of you ride in silence, after a few more minutes he turns on the radio and you listen to music the rest of the way.

Once you get into the city he speaks again "Where should I drop you off at?" You hadn't really thought that farahead yet and weren't sure where you wanted to go. "I guess anywhere is fine" He looks at you, but you're not sure exactly what the look on his face means. He pulls the car over a few blocks later. "Thank you" you" You say as you open the door to get out. You step out and are about to close the door when he shouts "Wait!" You turn around confused "My name is David," You feel stupid for not even remembering to ask him what his name was, "I'm having a party tonight, You should come along." He passes you a piece of paper with his name and address on it that you hadn't even seen him write. You take the Paper and close the door without confirming with him. Then you start walking to find what you originally came searching for.

Where will you go to get something to keep yourself entertained with?
1111.title: Accept the ride.

choices: Freak out and get as much distance between you and her as possible.
Ask her why she is staring at you.
1112.content:
"No thank you." You shake your head as you continue to walk beside the road. "I'm fine" The man gives you a confused look then gets into his car. You give a little sigh of relief, glad that he's going away. Unfortunately you are mistaken. The passenger side window slides open as he drives his car slowly up beside you. "You'll be walking for at least another three hours" he advises you as you continue to get annoyed by him. "I don't care" You shoot back picking up your pace, which doesn't really seem to affect anything as he is driving beside you.

The man stares at you for a moment more then shrugs "Have it your way" He rolls up the window of his car then begins to drive away. You watch as the car dissapears into the distance as you continue your trek towards the city.

Three hours later, you finally reach the city limits, your feet are aching from the four hour walk, your body isn't used to having to walk for that long. The sun is starting to set as you continue to walk. You've been to the city only a couple times before so you begin to walk the most familiar path into the city along the road.

Eventually, you find a bench to rest on to let your feet recover. You sit down and lie your head back, tired from the heat. You close your eyes momentarily to relax. That was your intention, but you slowly fall into a slumber and begin to sleep.

When you open your eyes, you notice it's dark out, "shoot" you say as you sit up. Upon sitting up you notice a woman sitting beside you looking at you...

Try to get on their good side.
112.content:
You begin to wander around town looking for something to catch your attention. After some time of excruciating useless walking about, you see some people you recognize while wandering through town square. A group of three students, a year below yours, are standing around talking quietly amongst themselves, You think that they must be skipping classes as it is sometime before classes actually end. Since you have nothing better to do you wander over to them. As you get closer A tall girl notices you walking toward them. The two are boys that are with her look the same at first glance but you can see minor differences as you approach, You know them almost immediately upon seeing them. Mostly because they are the only twins in your school

"Hey It's the NMI," The girl calls out, the boys turning to look at you. It takes you a moment but you quickly realize why she's calling you that. "What's that?" the boy known as Jack asked, or maybe it was Kyle. "The I is for insider," the other boy says rolling his eyes.

You frown at them and stop.

As soon as Juliet is gone you quickly go grab your jacket and put it on. then you start to head for the door. Before you make it to the door a voice calls your name. You stop and turn around, Your mom is standing in the kitchen staring at you while a frying pan behind her is flipping an egg. "Where are you going?" she asks you. "I just thought I would take a walk" You lie again. "I wanted to think." Your mother gives you an evaluative look then nods. "fine go ahead. just be back before I get home from work. I want to talk to you about this whole thing."

You roll your eyes at your mother "Yes Mom" you tell her "I'll be back before seven" before she can say anything back to you you're out the door. You head towards...

You run to Dorius's place. He's sitting outside in his garden, strumming on a guitar.

"Hi!" he calls, as you come running up. "I'm trying to create music like the non-magicals do, and I must say it's interesting." He strums a discordant chord, and you put your hands over your ears.

"Stop that, it's awful," you say. "Listen, how can you take it like that? Playing the guitar?"

"What else is there? Both of us are going to get our powers back in a year. Till then, let's at least enjoy being non-magical." He strums again, and you cover your ears quickly.

"DORIUS!" you shout, above his attempt at music.

"What?" he says, stopping again.

"We've got to get our powers back."

"How?"

"I don't know. Your Mom is a teacher. Let's check her books."

"Okay, she's out now. Come."

Both of you go into Dorius's Mother's room, and look for relevant books. There's an old witchery-rhyme book that you studied poems from when you were really small. You flip the pages nostalgically. Suddenly - there it is!

For to get your powers back

Say, "I don't care what happens next
I want powers on any pretext."

A bright flash filled the room, A new feeling welling up inside your chest. It's wasn't what you expected though, it felt like a sense of emptiness. The light quickly faded from the room, You and Darius still sitting in front of the book. "Did it work?" Darius's eyebrow raised slightly.

"There's only one way to find out" You Stand up, a sense of wonder overcoming you. Noticing his guitar, you point at it and mutter the appropriate words to make it fly into the air, only to see nothing happen.

choices: Continue to pursue answers elswhere
Retreat to Plan B ( behaving for a year)
122.content:
As you walk down the street you wonder where you could possibly go that would be helpful. Hm.... "The Library of Magic! Of Course! When someone's looking for answers, what's a better place to search then a library teaming with them." Fueled by a sudden spark of hope you turn at the next street.
The Library looms three blocks ahead. To a NMO it appears to be an abandon hotel, but that's just the glamor the Elder's use to keep it hidden. If they didn't, well let's just say it would be a disaster. In all actuality it is an astounding piece of architecture. It somewhat resembles a Roman cathedral, with giant marble colums and a triangle top like the parthenon. Only, the sculptures tell the story of the first wizard's battle against the NMO's and not the Gods of ancient Greece. In that time they knew about us and used our powers to better themselves. You can't help but long for life in that time. If you had committed your "high treason" then, no one would of batted an eyelash. Unfortunately you were not born in that time, and you did not get off that easy. The story of your life. you try and swallow the regret rising like bile in your throat. you should not have been punished for saving someone's life, NMO or not.
you head for the quartz steps with a reinforced purpose. "I will not stand aside and let them treat human beings as if they were creatures to waste!" you tell yourself with a new sense of vigor. You climb the steps and reach the front door. Behind it is a crotchity looking witch sitting behind a desk. She wears her unusually large glasses balancing low on her beak-like nose. Her lips are pursed in something similar to a grimace against a ghostly pale face. Her wispy gray hair is escaping from her bun in every which way, giving her a sort of rabid look. you're already intimidated.
You try to look calm as you walk by, but hear a none too subtle throat clearing. "I need your name please." Her keen glare stops you in your tracks. "M.. m.. my name?" you stutter.
"Yes, what you call yourself? Company policy." She looks impatient. "Since when?" I try to sound polite.
"The Chief Council of Elders established the policy a few days ago. Now if I could have your name?" She is peering at you over her ruby-rimmed glasses now. you're confused. You quickly tell her your name hoping that you don't sound as nervous as you feel. "I am sorry you are not on my list of magical beings. However you are on the list of recently terminated. I can not allow miscreants in this establishment. The security guards will escort you from the building." Now she's smiling.
122.title: Answers I'm sure. Denied I'm not.

choices: Look through some old papers for news of what happened in Scotland.
Ask your friends if they know what happened.
1221.content:
The guard approaches you slowly, almost as if he had just been sleeping. Compared to the librarion he almost looks like a harmless puppy. It's easy to tell that the library guard doesn't see much action. He gives you a look as if you should know better then motions for the front entrance. You head out towards the street as the guard follows you. As you start pushing the door open you turn to the guard
"How long has that policy been in place?" You ask as kindly as possible. He looks at you slightly confused,as if you were speaking a foreign language. After a couple moments he puzzles together what you're saying. "only about a month now" He pauses for a few moments as you watch him. You notice his name tag says 'L.Loth' and can't help but feel that it's strangely appropriate. "Some accident in Scotland," He says reluctantly, "Some NMOs caused some accident there. That's why the council's been so strict lately. This quickly grabs your attention since it may have something to do with why they were so strict with you.
"What happened?" You ask with more enthusiasm than you had intended. The man just shrugs at you, both because he had no idea and because it didn't really interest him. You nod and turn away. You begin to walk down the street pondering what could have been so bad. Maybe some old newspapers might have the answer. On the other hand it might be easier to just ask around. If it was really serious one of your friends must have heard something.
1221.title: The other Library.

choices: You are questioned at the airport.
You reach Scotland.
12211.content:
Although you had no magical powers, you still knew how magic worked and you used that knowledge to read witch writing in the old newspapers. It was an ancient language that NMOs can not see or even understand but you knew what to look for and could read it. One article in particular caught your eye...

'In a mountainous region of Scotland, known as the five sisters, an archeological dig discovered what the NMOs described as an ancient buried mansion. This confused the NMOs and they dug further to find the inside fully intact and untouched even though it had been buried. Two men were sent in to explore the mansion only something was triggered. One man returned from the sight, hysterically claiming the buried mansion was cursed as no other man returned...'

"I have heard rumors that a powerful ancient magic was lost to the witching world centuries ago." you whispered, pondering. "If that buried mansion holds that lost knowledge and I can return it to the council, they may favor me and grant me my powers back as a reward."

The idea had a certain appeal as you knew what to look for when it came to magical traps and how to avoid them, even with no power of your own. You decided to make the attempt, packing everything you thought you might need to raid a magical home without magic. "It'll be a challenge." you assured yourself. "NMOs have proven themselves powerful in many rights, maybe I can get a feel of that power and understand them more."

Soon, you had everything prepared and you had ordered the fight to Scotland, stating it was for a holiday to ensure the council did not try to stop you as it could be 'too dangerous'. "They act like everyone's mother." you muttered, walking out to a taxi. "Oh, well. Off to my 'vacation'."
12211.title: News of a strange find.

choices: Entering the mansion.
A warning first.
122112.content:
Arriving in Scotland a few hours later, you departed the plane to find that the area had been hit with an unusual cold spell with a powerful snow and ice storm outside. What was worse, you sensed this was not natural. "I didn't dress for this." you whispered, frowning.

Then, you spotted a tall gentlemen, holding up a sign with your name on it. You walked up to him and he seemed to recognize you immediately. "You are right on time, miss." he said with a smile on his face. "I am William. Welcome to Scotland, we were told you were interested in the buried mansion."

"Yes, I am." you replied, surprised. "How did you..."

The man chuckled. "The council watches after all of their members, powered or not." he said, kindly. "They are actually relieved that you are going onto this 'vacation'." he paused. "We can talk more on the road."

You nodded, understanding that talking about magic in front of NMOs makes them nervous, and followed William out of the airport to his car. Once on the road, minutes later, William said, "The two archeologists who vanished into the mansion were college students, all NMOs." he sighed. "The team had four members total, the one who managed to get away is now missing as well as the third member of the party."

"Has the NMO authorities stepped in yet?" you asked, curious.

"Weather conditions." replied William with a deep frown forming. "Everyone has the feeling this is not natural but we witches know that it was caused by magic."

"Something inside the mansion?" you asked, guessing.

"That's what the council believes." replied William. "I have been authorized to provide you with a few magical items to help you but no magic power, the spell used to 'turn it off' for a year can not be reversed. It has to run its course."

"Any ideas what I might encounter there?" you asked.

"Just a legend." replied William. "Thousands of years ago, an unknown group of NMOs tried to obtain magical power with four stolen mystic stones, each holding the power of one of the four elements."

"What happened?" you asked. "NMOs don't know shit about real magic."

"You don't need to know or understand much to work magical artifacts." said William with a sigh. "Briefly, they underestimated the power of the stones and unleashed raw magical energy onto the world. NMOs can not absorb raw magic and you know from your teachings that such magic is very cold. If not contained, it could place the Earth into a second ice age."

You gulped. "Why did the stones release raw energy?" you asked, startled.

The NMOs who stole the stones, not having any magic, did not have the knowledge to focus it into something they could absorb." replied William, simply. "You have that knowledge so you can focus that magic long enough to have a chance to stop the portal from being opened."

"Portal?" you asked, confused.

"Raw magic exists in another realm along with magical creatures such as dragons, unicorns and the such." simply, William replied. "Witches can channel into that realm and use magic. The stones opened a portal to that world, allowing the raw magic that exists there to spill into our world."

"How did they close the portal so long ago if they did not understand magic?" you asked, curious.'

"The only way they knew how." said William. "They kidnapped a young woman and threw her into the portal as a sacrifice only they did not know that the woman was a witch. She sacrificed herself to seal the portal... from the other side. Only, as revenge, she buried the entire town, including the mansion, to prevent the stones from ever being used again."

"This is deep." you said, rattled. "Do you think those four NMOs may have found the stones?"

"Let's just hope they're merely trapped in the buried town." said William. "We'll be at the dig sight in about five minutes, good luck, miss."

You nodded. "I have a feeling I'll need it."
122112.title: You reach Scotland.

choices: Get out and explore.
Move on into town.
1221122.content:
Upon arriving at the dig sight, William stopped the car and got out with you following. "This is as far as I can take you into the buried town, miss." he said. "I will open a hole large enough for you to drive the car in. When you are ready to get out, honk the horn and I'll open the hole again."

"Why do you want me to drive in?" you asked, curious.

"All of the magical artifacts I promised are in this car, miss." replied William. "Also, it will come in handy to drive the four young explorers out."

"What can I expect in there, William?" you asked, slightly nervous."

"The town is magically buried, miss." explained William. "Once inside, it will be as if you were on the surface only it will be bitter cold and the sky will be an illusion." urging you to the drivers side of the car, he added, "The town is devoid of life, all the people who lived there years ago were teleported out, hence we witches know the legend."

You nodded then got into the car. "Any advice for me before I go in?" you asked.

"Just a friendly warning." said William. "Although a trained witch can focus and absorb raw magic, too much can be lethal, be very careful." pausing he added, "Also, magical artifacts, even if you know how to use them, will only slow down a fully powered witch, do not confront the witch ghost directly."

I gulped at that then nodded as William opened a large hole into the ground like a downward slanting tunnel and I drove through a road leading into the buried town. "Grim Pines." reading the town sign, you said. "Sounds like a charming place."

As I stopped the car, you saw a small lodge just down the road to the left. As I turned forward to move on, you were surprised to see another car just ahead. "What the heck!?"

What do you do?

12211221.content:
you step out, keeping your wits about you as you can no longer work magic, and walk over to the other car. The closer you get to it the more you begin to sense magic. One does not need to have magic to sense it. You look about to see a road sign ahead of you changing from yield to stop. "That's odd." you think to yourself. you walk over and touch the sign only to have it vanish before your eyes. At the same time, you feel a small amount of magic within you. It was not much but it was definitely magical power. "Curious and more curious." You mutter. "At least I have some magic to use in an emergency."

You walk back to the car and open the driver's side door to sense more magic inside. Sitting in the driver's seat, You see the gear shift changing from a regular shifter to an eight ball, causing you to tough it as well. The eight ball vanishes, leaving the regular shifter and you feel more magic within you. It was a very small amount but it did boost your confidence. You look about for clues to find a set of keys on the passenger seat and a magical item, an enchanted mirror. Taking a chance, you pick up the mirror to find a woman's face looking back at you.

"Greetings, brave soul." she says. "Whoever you are, where ever you came from, go back while you still can. This place had been buried and sealed for a reason... leave sleeping dragons where they lie."

With that, the image vanishes, replacing it with your own reflection. "I take it the others did not heed this warning." you think. "Either that or they found this mirror too late."

Knowing you had to solve the mystery behind the missing NMOs, you take the keys and decide to...

There was a car jack which you did not see any significant need for, being unable to drive anywhere in this underground cavern. Still, for some reason, it was calling you towards it. Deciding to check the rest of the trunk, you found a medical kit, which you took.

"The NMOs I find may need medical attention." placing it into my special bag, you muttered. "What else might come in handy in my search of this place?"

After searching the entire trunk, I took a pair of binoculars, a compass as they go crazy when intense magic is near by, (early warning system), a flashlight, and some rope. Also, just in case, I took the car jack as well. "It's heavy enough to be used as a club, if needed." whispering, you said.

Keeping my guard up, I walked down the path that pointed to a bed and breakfast. It was more to set up a base camp than anything else. Along the way, I spotted some logs that would be helpful to start a fire so I added them to the bag but paused as I saw a recently dug hole. "Someone was looking for something." seeing other holes along the path. "I wonder what they were searching for."

I continued towards the bed and breakfast to find a quaint two story house with a garage in the near distance. Only, I also sensed magic. Looking around, I found...

1221122111.content:
Near the front door of the house, you found another small mirror like the one in the car. Upon picking it up, you saw the four archeologists William had mentioned. One of them was the girl you had seen in the first mirror, leaving you to guess that she had somehow managed to learn how to work the artifact or was a witch of some level herself.

"I don't like the looks of this place, guys." nervous, she said. "I heard legends of an entire town being buried to protect a deadly secret."

"I wonder what that secret was." mussing, the first man said. "Any ideas, Angelica?"

"Just what I read in my research of this area, Tony." shrugging, Angelica replied. "Still, I don't think we should be here, it might be dangerous."

You saw that Tony was a stout young man with short black hair and brown eyes. He was wearing hiking boots, blue jeans, and a thermal shirt. In fact everyone on the team was dressed the same way.

"Come off it, Angelica." smiling, Tony said. "Exploring any underground area is dangerous. Just keep your wits about you and I'm sure we'll be fine."

With that, the image vanished. You sighed, looking about and wondered where to go first. Finally, you decide to go...
1221122111.title: another enchanted mirror.

info.brief_description: A story about a witch who lost her powers, and must live powerless in a magical Society.
info.description:
You are a seventeen year old ex-witch. your powers were taken away from you when you broke one of the witch codes and revealed your powers to non-magical outsiders. Now you must cope with having no powers in a witching community.

chapters must be longer than three sentences.

Try to keep it clean people.

Do not name the main character.

Keep it in first person.
